taxonomicnotes: Described as a sub-species of Oryzias latipes and elevated to species status by Kottelat (2001). Further investigations of populations throughout its range may reveal this is a species complex (L. Parenti pers. comm. 2011).
rationale: This species is widely distributed throughout east Asia, where it lives in clear water swamps. Population trend is unknown, although this species is generally understood to be widespread, relatively abundant and represented by many populations throughout its range. Habitat destruction and degradation caused by numerous anthropogenic activities occurs throughout much of this species' range, however the impacts are currently unknown. This species may very occasionally occur in the international aquarium trade. Considering the wide geographic range of this species, it has been assessed as Least Concern.
